body: @guozhangwang WDYT?

I was looking into this, and I am not sure if reusing topic might be the root case. I would suggest, to delete and recreate user topics for each test. Note, that topic create/delete happens async so you need to add a check to avoid race conditions (cf. https://github.com/apache/kafka/pull/2757)

@mjsax good timing, fully agree! I'm on the wrong path here. I tried this https://github.com/original-brownbear/kafka/commit/ceaed371ed88525288f4893dd5a63a05341c7f1d in a loop today and couldn't get this to fail => disproved my own approach grml :) This will need a fix like you say too I think. I'll add a separate PR for that, this one just got confusing.
Sorry for wasting time here, I mistakenly assumed JUnit+Gradle to work similar to Surefire when it didn't!

LGTM and merged to trunk.
Yes. But we would like to merge Streams stuff in parallel to core stuff (ie, some Streams stuff before core stuff got merged).

@dguy One question otherwise LGTM: are there any streams unit tests that can get affected by this change to have longer time to complete, e.g. reset integration test etc? If that is true should we override it back to true?
retest this please.
\cc @apurvam @hachikuji @guozhangwang

We synced offline. We think it makes sense to put these APIs along with the new versions of the various RPCs into trunk, so that we can submit the transactional code incrementally directly into AK. 

We will have a bunch of dead code, but as long as the top level API Methods throw 'UnsupportedOperationException' it shouldn't cause too much confusion.
Having this in AK first would also enable smaller and more frequent PRs, which are easier to review.
